title: 112_s2180
content: The "Tax Credit for Early Educators Act of 2012" is introduced as a new section in the Internal Revenue Code, providing a tax credit for professional school personnel in early childhood education. The "Tax Credit for Early Educators Act of 2012" introduces a $3,000 tax credit for eligible individuals working in early childhood education positions involving student contact and program formulation or implementation. Eligible individuals must work in early childhood schools or programs as defined by State law. The $3,000 tax credit for eligible individuals in early childhood education positions will be adjusted for inflation after 2012. The adjustment will be based on the cost-of-living increase determined for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. "Section 25D of the tax code is amended to include a new item after the existing one." Section 25E adds provisions for professional school personnel in early childhood education. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011. Additionally, Section 3 introduces a deduction for certain expenses of early childhood, preschool, elementary, and secondary school teachers. The amendment to section 62(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code allows eligible educators to deduct expenses for books, supplies, computer equipment, and supplementary materials used in the classroom. This applies to taxable years before 2017. The amendment to section 62 of the Internal Revenue Code defines terms related to eligible educators, such as the applicable amount and eligible educator criteria. The term 'full-time educator' refers to an individual who meets certain hourly requirements in teaching. 'School' is defined as an institution providing elementary or secondary education. 'Preschool or early childhood program' refers to a program that offers preschool education and receives funding. The amendments made by this section apply to preschool programs or early childhood programs receiving funds under specific education acts, effective for taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. Modification of credit for dependent care services. The amendment allows a credit of 35 percent of employment-related expenses paid by an individual with qualifying dependents. Effective for taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
